details.access_and_opening_times:
Opening hours

Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm

2016 Public holidays

The embassy will be closed on the following days in 2016:

  • Friday 1 January
  • Friday 25 March
  • Monday 28 March
  • Monday 2 May
  • Thursday 5 May
  • Monday 16 May
  • Thursday 21 July
  • Monday 15 August
  • Tuesday 1 November
  • Friday 11 November
  • Friday 23 December
  • Monday 26 December
  • Tuesday 27 December

Getting to the embassy

By public transport

The nearest Metro stop is Schuman, on underground line 1 (Erasmus-Stockel) and 5 (Gare de l’Ouest-Hermann-Debroux). Buses number 12 and 21 (to and from Brussels national airport), as well as 22, 36, 60, 79, 344 and 345 (De Lijn) and E (TEC) also stop near our building. You can find further information on the local transportation website.

By car, bicycle or taxi

Parking can be difficult to find around Schuman. A excellent alternative is to use the city bicycle hire scheme Villo!. There are several Villo! bicycle stations nearby. Alternatively, you can also come by taxi.

Disabled access

The embassy is committed to enabling disabled visitors to carry out their work in Belgium in an effective and professional way. The embassy is ready to provide support to disabled visitors. Support could include, but is not limited to, meeting disabled visitors at the airport or train-station, arranging transport, accompanying visitors to meetings or secretarial assistance with writing and distributing reports. Every individual’s needs will be different. In order to ensure that we can make arrangements to meet your requirements, please contact the embassy Visits team (tel: +32 2 287 8305) at least 48 hours before you travel.

Security

All visitors will have to go through the security checkpoint at the entrance. Please co-operate with the security team as they conduct their checks which should only take a few minutes. The security measures in place are for the benefit of visitors and staff.

Opening hours

By appointment only

  • Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday, 09:00 to 12:30

  • Outside these opening hours a Consular Emergency Service is in operation 24/7 by calling +32 2 287 6211

2016 Public holidays

The British Consulate Brussels will be closed on the following days in 2016:

  • Friday 1 January
  • Friday 25 March
  • Monday 28 March
  • Monday 2 May
  • Thursday 5 May
  • Monday 16 May
  • Thursday 21 July
  • Monday 15 August
  • Tuesday 1 November
  • Friday 11 November
  • Friday 23 December
  • Monday 26 December
  • Tuesday 27 December

Getting to the British Consulate General

By public transport

By Metro

The nearest Metro stop is Schuman, on underground line 1 (Erasmus-Stockel) and 5 (Gare de l’Ouest-Hermann-Debroux).

By Bus

Buses number 12 and 21 (to and from Brussels national airport), as well as 22, 36, 60, 79, 344 and 345 (De Lijn) and E (TEC) also stop near our building. You can find further information on the local transportation on the following links below:

www.stib.be

http://www.delijn.be

http://www.infotec.be

On the above links there are route planners in English, you have to click on the EN link.

By train

The following link will provide you with the relevant information about the Belgian Railways. The closest train station is Schuman.

By Tram

Closest Tram line is Merode or Montgomery after which you will need to take the metro 1 direction Gare de l’Ouest / Wetstation stop Schuman

By car, bicycle or taxi

Parking can be difficult to find around Schuman. A excellent alternative is to use the city bicycle hire scheme Villo!. There are several Villo! bicycle stations nearby. Alternatively, you can also come by taxi.

From the the two National Airports

From Brussels National Airport

Brussels National Airport - British Consulate-General by taxi is about 12 kms and costs between 40-60 euros and takes about 30 minutes

Brussels National Airport – British Consulate-General by bus – Take bus 12 direction Brussels City costs around 5 euros and takes about 50 minutes

Brussels National Airport – British Consulate-General by train – Take train to Brussels-Schuman stop costs around 6 euros and takes about 30 minutes

From Brussels South (Charleroi) Airport

Brussels South Charleroi Airport – British Consulate-General by taxi is about 65 kms and costs between 60-100 euros (ask driver for price before entering the taxi)

Brussels South Charleroi Airport – British Consulate-General by bus – Take the airport bus to Brussels-Midi/Zuid which costs around 15 euros and then take the metro to Schuman

Brussels South Charleroi Airport – British Consulate-General by train – Take bus from airport to station costs around 3 euros – take train to Brussels-Midi/Zuid costs around 10 euros and then take the metro to Schuman

Disabled access

The embassy is committed to enabling disabled visitors to carry out their work in Belgium in an effective and professional way. The embassy is ready to provide support to disabled visitors. Support could include, but is not limited to, meeting disabled visitors at the airport or train-station, arranging transport, accompanying visitors to meetings or secretarial assistance with writing and distributing reports. Every individual’s needs will be different. In order to ensure that we can make arrangements to meet your requirements, please contact the Consulate (tel: +32 2 287 6211) at least 48 hours before you travel.

Security

All visitors will have to go through the security checkpoint at the entrance. Please co-operate with the security team as they conduct their checks which should only take a few minutes. The security measures in place are for the benefit of visitors and staff.
